FuncDef:
The fragment-threshold command configures the size of MP packet fragments.
The undo fragment-threshold command disables MP fragmentation.
This command varies in transport and router modes. For detailed differences, see Differences Between Commands in Transport and Router Modes. This topic describes the command configuration in router mode.
By default, MP fragmentation is disabled.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an MP fragmentation mode.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 3.
0 indicates that the size of MP packet fragments is 128 bytes.1 indicates that the size of MP packet fragments is 256 bytes.2 indicates that the size of MP packet fragments is 512 bytes.3 indicates that MP packets are not fragmented.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To improve bandwidth usage on an MP link, configure MP fragmentation and set a proper size for MP packet fragments.
Precautions
After the configuration, you must run the shutdown, commit, and undo shutdown commands in the corresponding interface view for the configuration to take effect.
